intro: Allionia pachyphylla, commonly known as the thick-leaved allionia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaryllidaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, an adaptation to its arid environment. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
